result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rowan D Nowicki in court.  Attorney Marcus J Berghahn in court for Rowan D Nowicki. Defense requests another status conference be set to allow time to discuss prelim waiver options with defendant. No objection from State.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any child under the age of 13 unless supervised by a responsible adult. 
- Defendant shall not post any content of a sexual or violent nature to any social media platform. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

08:44 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Marcus J Berghahn.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
